Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the Senate resolution by stating that it would prevent people from committing crime.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to support the assertion that the Senate resolution would prevent people from committing crime.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Senate resolution is necessary to restore $140 in monthly general assistance payments, when in fact, the payments were not in jeopardy.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as the final state budget maintained general assistance payments at their previous levels, contradicting the implication that the resolution was needed to restore the payments.
